voicesplitting.voice.hmm

Class HmmVoiceSplittingModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.generic.MidiModel
      • voicesplitting.voice.VoiceSplittingModel
        • voicesplitting.voice.hmm.HmmVoiceSplittingModel

  • public class HmmVoiceSplittingModel
extends VoiceSplittingModel
    An HmmVoiceSplittingModel is the model that performs voice separation as described in the paper.

    It contains a modified HMM, where the states are stored as HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 7 April, 2015

    • Method Detail

      • getHypotheses

        public java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> getHypotheses()
        This method returns a TreeSet of the current hypothesis HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates of this HmmVoiceSplittingModel.

        The most highly scoring state can be retrieved by using getHypotheses().first().

        NOTE: This is dependent on proper implimentation of the HmmVoiceSplittingModelState's compareTo method.

        Specified by:
        getHypotheses in class VoiceSplittingModel
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this HmmVoiceSplittingModel, in their natural order.

      • handleIncoming

        public void handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        This method takes as input some List of MidiNotes, and then does some work on the notes, updating its list of hypothesis HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates in the process. Here, we also ensure that the hypothesisStates list doesn't grow larger than HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters.BEAM_SIZE.

        NOTE: It is assumed that the note Lists passed into this method will be passed chronologically. Specifically, each time this method is invoked, it should be passed the List of MidiNotes which occur next in the MIDI song currently being read. This is done automatically by the NoteListGenerator.getIncomingLists() method.

        Usually, this method should do little more than simply passing along the notes list to its HmmVoiceSplittingModelState's HmmVoiceSplittingModelState.handleIncoming(List) method and updating current hypotheses with the result.

        Specified by:
        handleIncoming in class MidiModel
        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes which we want to handle next.

      • getF1

        public double getF1(java.util.List<java.util.List<MidiNote>> goldStandard)
        Get the F1-measure of the most likely HmmVoiceSplittingModelState's Voices from the hypothesisStates list.
        Parameters:
        goldStandard - The gold standard voices for the current song.
        Returns:
        The F1-measure of the most likely HmmVoiceSplittingModelState's Voices from the hypothesisStates list, or 0 if that list is empty.
